definitions: A statistical phenomenon in which two or more predictor variables in a multiple regression model are highly correlated, meaning that one can be linearly predicted from the others with a substantial degree of accuracy.
The state of having multiple highly correlated independent variables in a regression model.
examples: Detecting multicollinearity is crucial for model stability.
High multicollinearity can inflate standard errors.
Variance Inflation Factor (VIF) helps quantify multicollinearity.
